summary: This FBI situational report details the status of the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and the concurrent search of his private island, Little St. James, as of August 12, 2019. It outlines investigative steps, notes key events leading to Epstein's death, and reports on evidence collection and staff interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the death investigation; found unresponsive in his MCC jail cell on August 10, 2019, with a makeshift noose around his neck.

persons.name: Christopher Kroblin
persons.context: Met the FBI search team on the dock of Little St. James Island; had been informed of the pending search warrant the prior evening.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate at the MCC who was released on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.

persons.name: Karyna Shuliak
persons.context: The individual Epstein spoke to in an unmonitored 20-minute phone call from the MCC on the evening of August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Were cell mates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center until Reyes's release on August 9, 2019.
Epstein made a 20-minute unmonitored phone call to Shuliak from the MCC on August 9, 2019.
Kroblin, identified as an attorney, was present on Epstein's private island to meet the FBI search team, implying a legal representation role.

events.title: Epstein Remanded to MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was remanded to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein first attempted suicide via hanging and was discovered unconscious in his cell at approximately 1:27 a.m. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cell Mate Released; Unmonitored Call
events.description: Efrain Reyes was released, leaving Epstein alone. Later that evening, an MCC officer allowed Epstein to make an unmonitored 20-minute phone call to Karyna Shuliak.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his jail cell with a makeshift noose around his neck. He was pronounced dead at approximately 7:30 a.m.

events.title: Search of Little St. James Island
events.description: The Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force (CEHTTF) executed a search warrant on Epstein's private island, Little St. James, seizing digital evidence and documents.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Two MCC correctional officers who discovered Epstein's body had referred investigators to their attorneys and had not agreed to be interviewed as of August 12, 2019.

Initial MCC incident reports documented that two correctional officers falsified observation logs for Epstein's cell for the overnight hours of August 9-10, 2019, prompting a criminal investigation by the Office of Inspector General (OIG).
Video footage of the hallway leading to Epstein's cell block was confirmed to still exist on the MCC system, and retrieval efforts were initiated.
A drone from an unknown point of origin monitored the FBI search activities on Little St. James Island from close range.
Epstein was left alone in his cell after his cell mate's release on August 9, and he made an unmonitored phone call that same evening.
